storyInfo: Faced with a shortage of supplies, Fionn and Reed attempt to seek help from someone in a village, while Selmon decides to ransack a caravan.

attributes.content: Fischer, urgent correspondence from the Viscount...
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: ...Fischer?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Oi. Pondering some question for the ages again?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Apologies.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: While your mind has gone walkies taking in your jigsaw puzzle, that 'Harmonie' Feline has been continuing to act without pause, right here in County Trent.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: I assure you, my mind has not wandered, and surveillance of her has not slackened an inch.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: The way you act tells me the investigation's not made much headway.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: If surveillance during this stretch proves she's still loyal to her duty to Victoria, I'll be happier than if we catch a traitor.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I've never seen you happy period.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: After the failure of the last op, I thought I wouldn't see you in this office again.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Don't put it that way. The op itself wasn't a failure.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: And your results from the hospital?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain
Fischer
attributes.content: Acute infection, active Originium shards abundant in wounds...

attributes.name: Fischer
attributes.content: Of course, my condition is under control now, I assure. The occasional headaches will not impact my activities.
That said, I haven't reported the diagnosis to the superiors yet.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I consider myself as still able to assume the investigation into Harmonie, not to mention nobody would want to take over the scraps of info on this region.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: There is a true goal behind these smokebombs, and I have a duty to find it out.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: And I assure, I will maintain a distance from all others during this period.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: With my experience handling emergency situations, you didn't even need to add that last part.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: We of the Special Forces will continue supporting your investigation, as long as the city hall still lets you in.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Not going to say thanks?
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Haha, never mind that. I'm just cracking a joke. Trying to untense your muscles for once.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: Find some time to read the Viscount's letter, remember.
attributes.name: Special Forces Captain

attributes.content: An invitation card?
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Listen to you? Where are you going to take us?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We can't keep wandering in these wastes anymore. There's no settlements along the way you're pointing us.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You can forget picking berries in a place as lifeless as this, let alone hunting wild beasts. And besides, you don't know if the rain's going to pelt us with stones one day! No Catastrophe Messenger ever heads through there!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: I know exactly how many days it takes to cross the marsh. Food-wise, we plunder a Victorian caravan and job's done.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Oh, and that doctor's got enough medicine for us.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: She's not a doctor... and she's headed to a town herself. We agreed she'd part ways after escorting us to one, even. What do you take her for? A personal first-aid kit?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Everyone's got to throw everything they've got in with you, lives included, all because you want to be a little bit selfish, yeah? Am I wrong?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Shut up, Fionn! If you've got a problem, why don't you go off yourself? You think you can handle that?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Cowards don't survive.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Selmon!
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Oh, 'Reed'.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: You know how much I hate your nickname? It's like rocks and mud, all over the ground. I don't even know if I'm talking to you or the grass we walk by, haha.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I heard you two arguing.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There's... I have to tell you something. We can't go to Tulla village.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: The airwaves just said. The army suspects two factories there of secretly producing supplies for Dublinn. They drove out a bunch of people. A whole clash sparked off.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: We'll keep heading that direction for now. Forget catching the carrier... we'll probably get seized the moment we approach the village.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...*sigh* It's a miracle we got someone so capable to help us. Just barely made it out here.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Hah, you say that like you'll flag down a carrier and the good days'll come.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Escape from a factory into a mine somewhere else, until one lucky day a truck takes you somewhere other than Tara... You think that'll be a cakewalk?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I know of a lot who've fled that way.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: You saw them leave, that's all. Because their village went up in smoke, because they couldn't put crops in any wasteland around. THAT'S why they left. And you don't even know where they finished up, or if they did it alive or dead.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: And, do you even know where Tara is, or how far you go before you've escaped? They've never shown that on a map.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Stop trying to scare me with all these big questions! Does it make you right just because I can't answer?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Forget—forget it. I'll go talk with an old acquaintance here about borrowing some dry rations. *sigh* It's like all that blabbing you do's going to conjure up enough food to feed the dozen of us tomorrow.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: He's... very hurt.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No shit. He doesn't like telling lies, but he's got to come up with some porkies if he wants to borrow stuff. I'll be back, I can repay you, things like that.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I'll go and help him.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You talk too much like those Victorian officers from other parts. They won't trust you. Or are you just that good at lying?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: I just—don't like having to rob others.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And—I don't... like your selfishness either. It's the greatest lie of them all.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You're sure your friend said he saw Dublinn around here?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Why else wouldn't we be passing through here? Word spread among all the caravans. Everyone's opting to go the long way around just to avoid this belt.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: We wouldn't even have come here... if you hadn't vowed so solemnly we'd be fine.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Eh? But we're almost to your destination, and we haven't seen a thing yet.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Erm, it did happen some days ago. There's a chance they're further off by now.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: What I heard was Dublinn were scrambling on their way, so much they never even turned to look properly at my friend's caravan.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Oh. How many heads did he count? Which direction were they off in?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That way. Off into uninhabited wastes. As for how many, he said he couldn't count properly, and didn't dare to either.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: I've got no reason to lie to you, madams. We've got nothing to fear at all save those armed Dublinn bastards, and your average Taran hoodlums.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Poor places are always crawling with bandits or what have you. We have security measures in place, I can guarantee you that.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: By the time we found out County Oak Grove was migrating far and us caravans'd have to alter course through here, I'd already spent a hefty sum arming and armoring my people.
attributes.name: Caravan Head

attributes.content: Hold on a min, Chenchen... look over there.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: There's... someone dressed a lot like Dublinn there.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Fie, I tell you. That new tax ordinance they just announced, it's murder. None of us were so hard up in times before.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Fionn, foreign madam, I'd love to be able to help you... but I'm living on pennies these days too, and you can laugh if you want.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: On the one hand, you want to feed a dozen or so a meal each, and that's not nothing. On the other hand, you've got all these people with working limbs and working energy. You're best off coming up with your own solution.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: You know they've been sounding lights-out for years on the Scáthanna Fields exactly to hold off the starving, to stop us stealing some noble's prey, right?
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Faff. Who gives a toss about rules when you're starving for real? If you're just counting purely on others to help your need, I say you were born eating your head off!
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: No, no, no, never... They're all law-abiders, come on, that's why I'm even asking for a bite to eat on their behalf...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: —Maybe, I can do you something if you've got collateral.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Sorry, Fionn, but verbal guarantees don't do no use now.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: A book? That's not gonna do it, madam. Not sure I'd even trust this to prop up my bed.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Hello, is anyone in?
attributes.name: Worn Female Voice

attributes.content: Is that—
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Don't answer.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: That sick woman's here begging again. Does me in. You open the door for her, she'll be leaning on the frame talking your head off for an hour straight.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Leaning on the frame! She's an Infected! I'm scared she's gonna have my house's doorframe growing stones!
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Faff and all, those bloody beggars. I thought last winter might well've starved them to death... Shame they caught ill, but who asked them to loiter all over pestering people?
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: One sec, though, that voice... No, it can't be? But I wouldn't mistake it...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Fionn, do you recognize her?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I—I don't know... *sigh* Better not peek from the window...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Those are sounds of fighting.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Is somebody driving those Infected away?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: No, it's from the highway, outside the village.
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Oh, God, see what I said... That's what starving people do, they start bashing other people in with hoes!
attributes.name: Skint Farmer

attributes.content: Stop waiting. We doss around any more and the caravan's gonna pass us.
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: I'm willing to bet Fionn's not getting us food this time. Laughing stock he makes of himself asking and asking, doesn't even realize it.
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Those Victorians sneer at us day in, day out. What's a single bit of robbery to us or them? Weren't we gonna join Dublinn and fight the Victorians anyway?
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: But. But Reed might get angry with us. Doing something like this.
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Let her. Shouldn't we loot while we still have the energy to fight people? You want to wait until our heads are spinning before we do it?
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: And this is the first caravan we've seen in all these days. Who knows when the next chance'll come?
attributes.name: Tempersome Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Then. Maybe if we convince Reed to spring them with us? Then at least our chances of winning are a little better.
attributes.name: Overwrought Taran Refugee

attributes.content: Enough, stop bringing her up. What we're doing has nothing to do with her.
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Are you going to count on her, a foreigner, saving us forever?
attributes.name: Selmon

attributes.content: Move. We're doing this.
attributes.name: Selmon
